page.shortlink: gridproperties javascript - row events onkeypress property
page.description: This event fires when the user types a character in an editable field.

argument.name: event
argument.description: An object that contains information about the keyboard event, such as the key that was pressed. The properties available to you in this object are defined and set by the client's browser.

discussion.p: The *[ui:onKeyPress]* event fires when the user presses a key on the keyboard that produces a character value, such as a letter, number, or punctuation. Keys that do not produce a character, such as shift and alt, will not trigger the *[ui:onKeyPress]* event.
The event fires after the onKeyDown event. You can add Action Javascript, custom JavaScript, or sever-side Xbasic to execute one or more actions to this event.
For more information about keyboard events, see [Mozilla's documentation on KeyboardEvents] or the developer documentation for your favorite web browser.
